what: Why NHANES Data Matters (And Why It’s Been Frustrating to Use)
title: Getting Started with NHANES Data
text: National Health Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) one comprehensive public health datasets available. data tens thousands Americans spanning two decades, ’s invaluable resource understanding trends health, nutrition, disease, demographics. ’ve tried work NHANES data , ’ve likely encountered two major pain points: CDC server reliability: CDC’s data servers can slow, unresponsive, entirely. makes reproducible research difficult can’t count data availability. Cycle suffix confusion: CDC publishes data two-year cycles, different letter suffix. Want demographics data? ’ll need work DEMO, DEMO_B, DEMO_C, way DEMO_L. Finding right documentation becomes scavenger hunt, combining cycles requires careful data wrangling. nhanesdata package solves problems: Reliable access: datasets hosted Cloudflare R2 public URL, giving fast, dependable access anytime. Simplified naming: ’ve already merged cycles . Just ask demo get demographics data 1999-2023, year column track cycle observation belongs . Let’s get zero first NHANES analysis next 10 minutes.

title: Getting Started with NHANES Data
text: package builds excellent nhanesA package, provides foundation accessing NHANES data R. ’re grateful nhanesA developers’ work making CDC data accessible. nhanesdata package extends nhanesA providing: Pre-processed datasets fast access Automatic harmonization across survey cycles (1999-2023) Convenient search discovery functions

title: Getting Started with NHANES Data
text: ’s CDC’s naming system can trip . use read_nhanes('demo'), ’re getting data CDC publishes across multiple tables: matter? need look variable means, ’ll still need reference CDC’s documentation, uses cycle-specific names. example, ’re working 2015-2016 data, ’ll want DEMO_I codebook. get_url() function helps : return full URL CDC’s documentation page can find variable descriptions, value codes, survey methodology notes. 2019-2020 survey cycle (suffix K) included datasets provided package. title: Getting Started with NHANES Data
text: common workflow load join multiple related datasets. NHANES data becomes powerful combine information different examinations questionnaires. Important joining principles: Always join seqn year together seqn column participant ID (unique within cycle) year column ensures join observations survey cycle
code: # Load three related datasets # Dataset names are case-insensitive - use whichever style you prefer demo <- read_nhanes("demo") # Demographics (age, gender, etc.) bpx <- read_nhanes("BPX") # Blood pressure measurements bmx <- read_nhanes("Bmx") # Body measurements (height, weight, BMI)  # Combine the datasets using inner_join() # inner_join() keeps only participants who appear in ALL datasets # We join by 'seqn' (participant ID) and 'year' (survey cycle) analysis_data <- demo |>   inner_join(bpx, by = c("seqn", "year")) |>   inner_join(bmx, by = c("seqn", "year")) |>   select(year, seqn, ridageyr, riagendr, bpxsy1, bmxbmi)  # View the first few rows head(analysis_data)

title: Getting Started with NHANES Data
text: Since datasets include cycles, can filter specific time periods:
code: # Load demographics demo <- read_nhanes("demo")  # Filter to recent cycles only (2015 and later) recent_demo <- demo |>   filter(year >= 2015)  # Compare across time periods demo |>   mutate(     period = case_when(       year < 2010 ~ "1999-2009",       year < 2020 ~ "2010-2019",       TRUE ~ "2020+"     )   ) |>   group_by(period) |>   summarise(n_participants = n())

what: A Complete Example: Blood Pressure by Age Group
title: Getting Started with NHANES Data
text: Let’s put together realistic analysis examining blood pressure varies age. example include one rendered plot showing results:  analysis combines data 100,000 individuals across multiple survey cycles reveal well-known pattern increasing blood pressure age. without dealing single CDC server timeout cycle suffix.
code: # Step 1: Load required datasets demo <- read_nhanes("demo") bpx <- read_nhanes("bpx")  # Step 2: Select demographic variables for adults demo_adults <- demo |>   filter(ridageyr >= 18) |> # adults only   select(seqn, year, ridageyr, riagendr, ridreth1)  # Step 3: Select blood pressure variables bp_vars <- bpx |>   select(seqn, year, bpxsy1, bpxdi1)  # Step 4: Combine the datasets using inner_join() # inner_join() matches rows that appear in BOTH datasets # We join by 'seqn' (participant ID) and 'year' (survey cycle) bp_combined <- demo_adults |>   inner_join(bp_vars, by = c("seqn", "year"))  # Step 5: Filter to valid blood pressure readings and create age groups bp_analysis <- bp_combined |>   filter(     !is.na(bpxsy1), # valid systolic BP     !is.na(bpxdi1), # valid diastolic BP     bpxsy1 > 0, # exclude special codes     bpxdi1 > 0   ) |>   mutate(     age_group = cut(       ridageyr,       breaks = c(18, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, Inf),       labels = c("18-29", "30-39", "40-49", "50-59", "60-69", "70-79", "80+"),       right = FALSE     )   )  # Step 6: Calculate mean BP by age group # group_by() creates groups for each age category # summarize() calculates summary statistics within each group bp_summary <- bp_analysis |>   group_by(age_group) |>   summarize(     n = n(),     mean_systolic = mean(bpxsy1),     mean_diastolic = mean(bpxdi1),     .groups = "drop"   ) # Step 7: Visualize the results bp_summary |>   ggplot(aes(x = age_group)) +   geom_col(aes(y = mean_systolic), fill = "coral", alpha = 0.7) +   geom_col(aes(y = mean_diastolic), fill = "steelblue", alpha = 0.7) +   labs(     title = "Blood Pressure Increases with Age",     subtitle = "Mean systolic (coral) and diastolic (blue) BP by age group",     x = "Age Group",     y = "Blood Pressure (mmHg)"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: nhanesdata: Pre-processed NHANES Data with Automated Updates
text: Key joining principle: Always join seqn (participant ID) year (survey cycle). participant can appear multiple survey cycles, sequence number can reused across cycles.
code: library(nhanesdata) library(dplyr)  # Load related datasets demo <- read_nhanes('demo')        # Demographics bpx <- read_nhanes('BPX')          # Blood pressure measurements bmx <- read_nhanes('Bmx')          # Body measurements  # Combine datasets using inner_join() # Always join on BOTH seqn AND year analysis_data <- demo |>   inner_join(bpx, by = c('seqn', 'year')) |>   inner_join(bmx, by = c('seqn', 'year')) |>   select(year, seqn, ridageyr, riagendr, bpxsy1, bmxbmi)

title: Get CDC Documentation URL for NHANES Table — get_url
text: Constructs returns full CDC documentation URL given NHANES table. function handles table names without cycle suffixes (e.g., "DEMO_J" 2017-2018 "DEMO" 1999-2000) automatically maps suffix appropriate survey cycle year.

title: Get CDC Documentation URL for NHANES Table — get_url
code: get_url(table)

title: Get CDC Documentation URL for NHANES Table — get_url
text: table Character. table variable information needed. Can include cycle suffix (e.g., "DEMO_J") (e.g., "DEMO"). case-sensitive.

title: Get CDC Documentation URL for NHANES Table — get_url
text: Character string (invisibly). Full URL CDC data documentation, codebook, frequencies returned invisibly also printed console via message() interactive use.

title: Get CDC Documentation URL for NHANES Table — get_url
code: # These examples will run and display URLs get_url("DEMO_J") # Demographics 2017-2018 #> https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/data/nhanes/public/2017/datafiles/DEMO_J.htm get_url("diq_j") # Case-insensitive: Diabetes 2017-2018 #> https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/data/nhanes/public/2017/datafiles/DIQ_J.htm get_url("DIQ") # No suffix = 1999-2000 cycle #> https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/data/nhanes/public/1999/datafiles/DIQ.htm  # Capture the URL for programmatic use url <- get_url("BMX_J") #> https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/data/nhanes/public/2017/datafiles/BMX_J.htm

text: Downloads pre-processed NHANES data files cloud storage. Data includes survey cycles (1999-2023) automatically merged harmonized, quarterly updates.

code: read_nhanes(dataset)

title: Read NHANES Data from Cloud Storage — read_nhanes
text: dataset Character. NHANES dataset base name (e.g., "trigly", "demo"). Case-insensitive - use 'demo', 'DEMO', 'Demo' interchangeably. Must single string (length 1). Leading/trailing whitespace automatically trimmed.

title: Read NHANES Data from Cloud Storage — read_nhanes
text: tibble containing requested NHANES dataset across available survey cycles. Always includes year seqn columns plus dataset-specific variables.

title: Read NHANES Data from Cloud Storage — read_nhanes
text: function downloads NHANES datasets cloud storage (hosted nhanes.kylegrealis.com). datasets combine multiple survey cycles automatic type harmonization. Data updated quarterly via automated workflows pull fresh data CDC servers. Dataset names case-insensitive throughout package. Use uppercase (matches CDC documentation) lowercase (easier type) - work identically. Error handling: function validates inputs provides informative error messages dataset fails load (e.g., network issues, non-existent datasets, misspelled names). Error messages include attempted URL suggestions troubleshooting.

title: Read NHANES Data from Cloud Storage — read_nhanes
code: # All case variations work identically: trigly <- read_nhanes("trigly") # Lowercase #> Loading: TRIGLY #> TRIGLY complete! (27,039 rows) demo <- read_nhanes("DEMO") # Uppercase #> Loading: DEMO #> DEMO complete! (113,249 rows) acq <- read_nhanes("Acq") # Mixed case #> Loading: ACQ #> ACQ complete! (89,381 rows)  # Load multiple datasets datasets <- c("demo", "BPX", "bmx") |>   purrr::map(read_nhanes) #> Loading: DEMO #> DEMO complete! (113,249 rows) #> Loading: BPX #> BPX complete! (96,766 rows) #> Loading: BMX #> BMX complete! (96,288 rows)

what: Search NHANES Variables by Term or Phrase — term_search
title: Search NHANES Variables by Term or Phrase — term_search
text: convenience wrapper around nhanesA::nhanesSearch returns simplified, concise output focused variable names, descriptions, survey years. Results sorted year (recent first) variable name.

title: Search NHANES Variables by Term or Phrase — term_search
code: term_search(var)

title: Search NHANES Variables by Term or Phrase — term_search
text: var Character. Search term phrase find variable names descriptions. Case-insensitive. Special regex characters automatically escaped literal matching.

title: Search NHANES Variables by Term or Phrase — term_search
text: data.frame 4 columns: Variable.Name: NHANES variable code Variable.Description: Description variable Data.File.Name: Name data file containing variable Begin.Year: Starting year survey cycle (numeric) Results sorted Begin.Year (descending) Variable.Name. Returns empty data.frame correct structure matches found.

title: Search NHANES Variables by Term or Phrase — term_search

title: Internal Utility Functions — utils
text: file contains internal helper functions used across nhanesdata package. functions exported meant internal package use .

what: Search for NHANES Variable by Exact Name — var_search
title: Search for NHANES Variable by Exact Name — var_search
text: convenience wrapper around nhanesA::nhanesSearchVarName searches variables exact variable name match. function automatically converts input uppercase match NHANES naming conventions. Use know variable code; use term_search() text-based searches.

title: Search for NHANES Variable by Exact Name — var_search
code: var_search(var)

title: Search for NHANES Variable by Exact Name — var_search
text: var Character. Variable name search . automatically converted uppercase. case-sensitive.

title: Search for NHANES Variable by Exact Name — var_search
text: data.frame showing occurrences variable across survey cycles, including variable descriptions, data file names, years available. Returns empty data.frame appropriate structure variable found.

title: Search for NHANES Variable by Exact Name — var_search
code: # \donttest{ # Search for specific variable (case-insensitive) var_search("RIAGENDR") # Gender variable #>  [1] "BFRPOL_D" "BFRPOL_E" "BFRPOL_F" "BFRPOL_G" "BFRPOL_H" "BFRPOL_I" #>  [7] "DEMO"     "DEMO_B"   "DEMO_C"   "DEMO_D"   "DEMO_E"   "DEMO_F"   #> [13] "DEMO_G"   "DEMO_H"   "DEMO_I"   "DEMO_J"   "DEMO_L"   "DOXPOL_D" #> [19] "DOXPOL_E" "DOXPOL_F" "DOXPOL_G" "DOXPOL_H" "DOXPOL_I" "PCBPOL_D" #> [25] "PCBPOL_E" "PCBPOL_F" "PCBPOL_G" "PCBPOL_H" "PCBPOL_I" "PSTPOL_D" #> [31] "PSTPOL_E" "PSTPOL_F" "PSTPOL_G" "PSTPOL_H" "PSTPOL_I" "P_DEMO"   #> [37] "SSBFR_B"  "SSPCB_B"  "SSPST_B"  var_search("ridageyr") # Age variable (auto-converted to uppercase) #>  [1] "DEMO"   "DEMO_B" "DEMO_C" "DEMO_D" "DEMO_E" "DEMO_F" "DEMO_G" "DEMO_H" #>  [9] "DEMO_I" "DEMO_J" "DEMO_L" "P_DEMO"  # See where glucose variables appear var_search("LBXGLU") #>  [1] "GLU_D"   "GLU_E"   "GLU_F"   "GLU_G"   "GLU_H"   "GLU_I"   "GLU_J"   #>  [8] "GLU_L"   "L10AM_B" "L10AM_C" "LAB10AM" "P_GLU"   # }

title: nhanesdata 0.2.0
text: Released: Feb. 2026

title: nhanesdata 0.2.0
text: Categorical columns across datasets now stored character human-readable labels instead raw numeric codes. example, BMX bmdbmic values like 2, 3, 4, 1 now "Normal weight", "Overweight", "Obese", "Underweight". affects 95 variables across 22 datasets.

title: nhanesdata 0.2.0
text: Fixed data corruption factor--numeric conversion returned internal level indices instead actual CDC codes (e.g., codes 1, 3, 4 silently stored 1, 2, 3). Fixed continuous variables like ridageyr indfmpir corrupted categorical label mappings incorrectly applied . Fixed column type clashes binding survey cycles column existed cycles others.

title: nhanesdata 0.2.0
text: Cross-cycle label translation: CDC codebook unavailable particular cycle, labels now carried sibling cycle waves consistent human-readable values. Added 5 new datasets: dxxag, l10, l10am, lab10, lab10am (71 datasets total). Added inst/CITATION citation("nhanesdata") support.

title: nhanesdata 0.2.0
text: Added Amrit Baral, Natalie Neugaard, Johannes Thrul, Janardan Devkota contributors.

title: nhanesdata 0.1.1
text: Released: Jan. 2026

title: nhanesdata 0.1.1
text: Automated quarterly data updates via GitHub Actions checksum-based change detection Cloudflare R2 uploads. Replaced pins direct R2 uploads simpler URL structure. Added dataset catalog vignette searchable table.

title: nhanesdata 0.1.0
text: read_r2() renamed read_nhanes(). pull_nhanes() longer exported; use read_nhanes() load data.

title: nhanesdata 0.1.0
text: Reduced required dependencies (moved 7 packages Suggests). Dataset names now case-insensitive. Improved error messages get_url() reliability.

title: nhanesdata 0.1.0
text: Fixed pull_nhanes() save() failed “object found” error. Fixed NULL handling term_search() var_search(). Fixed Begin.Year column converting numeric.

title: nhanesdata 0.0.0.9000 (2025-11-17)
text: Initial development version core functionality accessing managing NHANES data.
